intro: Gnidia daphnifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf gnidia, is a South African plant belonging to the family Rutaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red fruits containing seeds. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions. Gnidia daphnifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
